text.section: Additional individuals, other than officials, shall disclose information annually if designated pursuant to subsection (b) of this section.

For disclosure under this section:
the Governor, by executive order, may designate:
an employee of an executive unit; or
a noncompensated appointee of the Governor;
the Chief Judge of the Court of Appeals, by order, may designate:
an employee of the Judicial Branch; or
a noncompensated appointee of the Court of Appeals or the Chief Judge; and
the presiding officers of the General Assembly, by order, may designate:
an employee of the Legislative Branch; or
a noncompensated appointee of either or both of the presiding officers.

A statement filed under this section is a public record and shall contain the relevant information concerning the financial affairs of the individual submitting the statement that is considered necessary by the applicable designating authority.

section.section:
An employee under paragraph (1) of this subsection shall file a statement in accordance with § 15-601 of this subtitle, that:
discloses any interest the employee may have in any real property in the State; and
discloses any other information the Ethics Commission considers a conflict of interest related to the employment of the employee.
